tasks: Create a user persona for an existing company, focusing on their target audience's pain points and motivations (Reference: 'Jobs-to-be-Done' framework). Document your thought process and assumptions in a 2-page report.
Conduct 2 usability tests using the 10 Usability Heuristics from nngroup.com. Analyze the results and provide actionable feedback for improvement.
Develop a simple wireframe of a hypothetical product feature, focusing on clear typography and color scheme (Reference: Jakob's Law).
Create a user research plan for an upcoming project, outlining the methods you'll use to gather insights. Present your plan to a colleague or mentor.
Redesign the navigation of your portfolio using the 8-point grid system. Document your design decisions and provide examples of how they improve user experience.
Develop a 'Design System' document for a hypothetical company, outlining their visual design principles and guidelines.
Conduct 2 user interviews using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect framework. Analyze your findings and provide recommendations for improving the overall aesthetic of a product.
Create a 'User Journey Map' for an existing company, highlighting pain points and areas for improvement. Present your map to stakeholders.
Develop a 'Design System' component library for a hypothetical company, outlining reusable UI elements and their design principles.
Create a comprehensive 'Design System' document for an existing company, outlining their visual design principles, guidelines, and components. Present your document to stakeholders.

Develop a 'User Research' plan for a hypothetical project, outlining the methods you'll use to gather insights. Conduct 2 usability tests using the '10 Usability Heuristics' from nngroup.com. Analyze the results and provide actionable feedback for improvement.
Create a 'Portfolio' redesign using the 'Law of UX' principles (Miller's Law, Jakob's Law). Document your design decisions and provide examples of how they improve user experience.

resources.readup: As an emerging senior UX designer, you have a solid foundation in UX fundamentals and a keen eye for visual design. To take your career to the next level, focus on developing a deeper understanding of product thinking and strategy, while continuing to refine your research and validation skills.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Mastering Usability Heuristics for Enhanced UX Design
topics.summary: Develop a deep understanding of usability heuristics to create intuitive and user-friendly interfaces, addressing the Emerging Senior's weakest area (78/100).

topics.name: Applying Cognitive Psychology Principles for Effective User Research
topics.summary: Acquire expertise in cognitive psychology principles to design more effective user research methods, addressing the Emerging Senior's weakest area (76/100).

topics.name: Crafting Compelling UI Design with Aesthetic-Usability Effect and Visual Hierarchy
topics.summary: Develop a solid understanding of the aesthetic-usability effect and visual hierarchy to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces, addressing the Emerging Senior's weakest area (80/100).
